definition:
&%Fogging is &%Water droplets or &%Ice &%Crystal 
suspended in the &%EarthAtmosphere, &%causes &%visibilityInMeteorology to be reduced to 
less than 1,000 &%Meter.
opposite_reasoning: ClearWeather provides the strongest semantic opposition within the meteorological domain. Fogging is a weather phenomenon characterized by suspended particles reducing visibility; ClearWeather represents the opposite state with no obscuring particles and maximum visibility. This opposition is: (1) domain-appropriate (both meteorological processes), (2) captures the key opposition on visibility and atmospheric clarity, (3) likely exists in SUMO ontology, (4) provides clean semantic distance for Fisher-LDA centroid separation. While HighVisibility has slightly stronger opposition on the defining attribute, ClearWeather is more likely to exist as a complete concept in the ontology and provides better coverage of the overall phenomenon.
